featured.text: In 1790, President George Washington declared that the federal government would reside in a district “not exceeding ten miles square … on the river Potomac.”
Originated in Japan, these hotels were initially meant for business professionals to stay close to populated business districts without spending a lot.
The White House is located in a district not larger than ten miles square.
The structure, to be erected in the redeveloped areas of the capital’s 13th district, will cost 250 million francs (US$42 million).

definition.en_def: A defined area or region, often for administrative purposes.
definition.example: The school is located in a different district from where I live.
